posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
I have a Paladin build that after I was able to get it to level 51 I decided I did not like it.  I was lucky enough to
find a DM that was willing to help me relevel her.  Now she is at level 1 with enough Exp for level 51.  Now I have to try to
figure out what I should do with her.  What build would be best.  I am told the Paladin Quest sword will get an upgrade
and it will be very nice.  Needs 25 levels of Paladin to use it.  Also the Paladin artifact needs 25 levels of Paladin too
One of the things the amulet gives is Hide in Plain Sight

Her start stats are

Str 14
Dex 10
Con 16
Int 12
Wis 10
Chr 16

Blind Fight
Toughness

Her subrace is
githyanki
Restrictions: Race - Human
Favored Class: Fighter
No Druid or Shifter levels Permitted. No Mage shifting.
Benefits: +2 Dex, +2 Con, Base 5 SR +2 SR/lvl (does not stack with monk SR)
Feats:
Darkvision
Weapon Proficiency Exotic
Negatives: -2 Wis
ECL: 2

 
Any suggestions?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
How did it let you make a Paladin with 10 WIS?

Anyway you already have a very strong build as a suggestion in the previous thread (Wing Commander, i think) so i suspect you want something different this time.

Hmm, how about "Knight of the Quest" - (Paladin 26/ Rogue 4/ CoT 10) by grizzled dwarflord, in the legacy ECB archives? He is a Great Smiter too, although i don't know if you like that or not, but without Paladin spells at least it will be interesting to do something else besides swing your sword around all the time.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content: That one is not bad.  One needs 37 Str to equip the best shield though.  May have to think about this.  at level 54 I probably could get 12 points of str to get up to a 32 str.  Might be a lost cause.  Not sure  :(

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content: I think I will probably go with the Wing Commander.  I could probably get everything I want with that build
